item.title: Project Vend: How Claude AI Ran a Business and What It Reveals About Autonomous Agents
item.description:
Introduction

In early 2024, Anthropic conducted an unusual experiment that would reveal both the remarkable capabilities and surprising vulnerabilities of advanced AI systems. Project Vend was not a theoretical exerciseâ€”it was a real-world test where Claude AI was tasked with running an actual business from start to finish. The experiment involved setting up a vending machine in Anthropic’s offices and allowing Claude to manage every aspect of the operation: sourcing products from wholesalers, setting prices, handling customer interactions via Slack, managing inventory, and ultimately, making money. What started as a curious exploration of AI capabilities quickly became a fascinating case study in the challenges of deploying autonomous agents in complex, real-world scenarios. This article explores the key findings from Project Vend, the unexpected problems that emerged, and what these insights mean for the future of AI-powered business automation.
